Recording A-Bomb Deaths

 

By the end of 1945, the atomic bombs had killed an estimated 214,000 people in Japan.

To remember them, the two cities began recording their deaths.

August 1945

The U.S. drops atomic bombs

on Hiroshima and Nagasaki

2018

493,344 total recorded as killed

400,000

1968

90,426 total recorded as killed

Nagasaki city begins listing people killed

in the bombing of Nagasaki

300,000

1952

57,902 recorded as killed

Hiroshima city begins listing people killed

in the bombing of Hiroshima

200,000

100,000

1945

1955

1985

1995

2005

2015

1965

1975

Sources: Hiroshima and Nagasaki city hall

Notes: Relatives of the deceased apply to the city halls to register the deaths. Many victims are unidentified,

and the lists do not include everyone who was killed by the bombs.

Recording A-Bomb Deaths

By the end of 1945, the atomic bombs had killed an estimated 214,000 people in Japan.

To remember them, the two cities began recording their deaths.

August 1945

The U.S. atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki

2018

493,344 recorded as killed

1968

90,426 recorded as killed

Nagasaki city begins its list

400,000

300,000

1952

57,902 recorded as killed

Hiroshima city begins its list

200,000

100,000

1945

1955

1985

1995

2005

2015

1965

1975

Sources: Hiroshima and Nagasaki city hall

Notes: Hiroshima and Nagasaki each record those killed in the bombing of their respective cities.

Relatives of the deceased apply to the city halls to register the deaths. Many victims are unidentified,

and the lists do not include everyone who was killed by the bombs.

Recording A-Bomb Deaths

In August 1945, the U.S. dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

To remember them, the two cities began recording their deaths.

1945

Estimated 214,000 people killed by the atomic bombs

1952

57,902 recorded as killed

Hiroshima city creates a list of people killed in the bombing of Hiroshima

1968

90,426 total recorded as killed

Nagasaki city creates a list of people killed in the bombing of Nagasaki

2018

493,344 total recorded as killed

Sources: Hiroshima and Nagasaki city hall

Notes: Hiroshima and Nagasaki each record those killed in the bombing of their respective cities.

Relatives of the deceased apply to the city halls to register the deaths. Many victims are unidentified,

and the lists do not include everyone who was killed by the bombs.
